name: MICT1
tagline: Minor Digital Forensics: Reverse Engineering Data
body:
### Welcome to the course site for MICT1!
Below you will find links discussed in the lectures.

#### Week 1
* Help sites for both [Git](https://progit.org/) and [Github](https://guides.github.com/).
* News article about the [Casey Anthony case](http://www.nytimes.com/2011/07/19/us/19casey.html).
* Visualization showing the [6502 processor in action](http://www.visual6502.org/JSSim/index.html).
* Unicode information on both the [double happiness](http://www.fileformat.info/info/unicode/char/56cd/index.htm) and [pile of poo](http://www.fileformat.info/info/unicode/char/56cd/index.htm) characters.
* Wikipedia pages to read for this week:
    1. [Endianness](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Endianness)
    2. [Unicode](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unicode)
    3. [Serialization](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serialization)
* Additional useful Wikipedia pages:
    1. [Digital forensics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_forensics)
    2. [UTF-8](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UTF-8) (see also [Byte order mark](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Byte_order_mark) and [Comparison of Unicode encodings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comparison_of_Unicode_encodings).)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
